sen.j: 中山 美伎（なかやま みき、寛政10年4月18日 (旧暦)（1798年6月2日） - 明治20年1月26日 (旧暦)（1887年2月18日））は、日本の宗教家、天理教教祖。
sen.e: Miki NAKAYAMA (April 18, 1798 to February 18, 1887) was a Japanese religious leader and the founder of Tenrikyo.
Miki NAKAYAMA (June 2, 1798 to February 18, 1887) was a Japanese religious leader (the founder of the Tenrikyo-sect).
sen.cmt: 結合しました。and→She wasTenrikyo→the Tenrikyo-sect
sen.e: Miki NAKAYAMA (June 2, 1798 to February 18, 1887) was a Japanese religious leader (the founder of the Tenrikyo-sect).

sen.j: 天理教の信者からは「おやさま」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: She was called "Oyasama" (Parent) by the believers of Tenrikyo.
She is called "Oyasama" (Parent) by the followers of Tenrikyo.
sen.cmt: 過去形を現在形にしました。Believers→followers
sen.e: She is called "Oyasama" (Parent) by the followers of Tenrikyo.

sen.j: 寛政10年4月18日の朝に、大和国山辺郡三昧田村（現在の奈良県天理市三昧田町）の前川半七の家に生まれる。
sen.e: On the morning of April 18, 1798, she was born to the family of Hanshichi MAEKAWA in Sanmaiden Village of Yamabe Country of Yamato Province (today Sanmaidencho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture).
On the morning of April 18, 1798, she was born to the family of Hanshichi MAEKAWA in Sanmaiden Village of Yamabe Country in Yamato Province (present day Sanmaidencho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: On the morning of April 18, 1798, she was born to the family of Hanshichi MAEKAWA in Sanmaiden Village of Yamabe Country in Yamato Province (present day Sanmaidencho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 前川家は浄土宗の檀家であったので、その感化を幼時より受ける。
sen.e: Maekawa family was a parishioner of Jodo (Pure Land) sect, so she was influenced by the sect since her childhood.
For generations, the Maekawa family had been parishioners of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect, so she was influenced by the sect since her childhood.
For generations, the Maekawa family had been parishioners of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect; therefore she was influenced by the sect since her childhood.
sen.cmt: so は口語的なので表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 浄土宗の僧侶になることを希望し、19歳の時に五重相伝を受ける。
sen.e: She wished to become a Jodo (Pure Land) sect priest and received Goju Soden (fivefold transmission).
She aspired to become a Jodo (Pure Land) sect priestess, and received Goju Soden (fivefold transmission) at age 19.
sen.cmt: 「19歳の時」が訳漏れでしたので訳を入れました。女性ですので"priest"を"priestess"に修正しました。wishをaspireに変えました。
sen.e: She aspired to become a Jodo (Pure Land) sect priestess, and received Goju Soden (fivefold transmission) at age of 19.

sen.j: 浄土宗の熱心な信者だった。
sen.e: She was a devout believer of Jodo (Pure Land) sect.
She was a devout believer of Jodo (Pure Land) sect.
She was a devout believer of Jodo (Pure Land) sect.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)7年9月15日 (旧暦)（1810年10月13日）に中山善兵衞に嫁ぐ（この中山家を、天理教では「元の屋敷」と呼ぶ）。
sen.e: On October 13, 1810, she married Zenbei NAKAYAMA (this NAKAYAMA family is referred to as "the Residence of Origin" in Tenrikyo).
On October 13, 1810, she married Zenbei NAKAYAMA (The NAKAYAMA family is referred to as "the Residence of Origin" in Tenrikyo).
On October 13, 1810, she married Zenbei NAKAYAMA (The NAKAYAMA family is referred to as "the Residence of Origin" in Tenrikyo).

sen.j: 天保9年（1838年）、まず10月23日に、長男秀司が足痛で苦しんだとき、修験者市兵衛を招き祈祷をおこなった。
sen.e: On October 23, 1838, when her eldest son Shuji was suffering from pain in the leg, she invited Ichibei, an ascetic Buddhist monk, to perform an incantation and she herself substituted for his medium, and this is said to be the moment when she was possessed by and received a revelation from Tenri O no Mikoto, who is Oyagami (God the Parent) and calls himself "God of Origin, God in Truth."
On October 23, 1838, when her eldest son Shuji was suffering from leg pain, she invited Ichibei, an ascetic Buddhist monk, to perform an incantation.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現になるよう修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On October 23, 1838, when her eldest son Shuji was suffering from leg pain, she invited Ichibei, an ascetic Buddhist monk, to perform an incantation.

sen.j: そして、みき自ら加持代となり、このとき、「元の神、実の神」と自ら名乗る、親神（おやがみ）・天理王命（てんりおうのみこと）がみきに乗り移り、天啓を受けたとされている。
sen.e: She volunteered to be his substitute, and this is said to be the moment when she was possessed by and received a revelation from Tenri O no Mikoto, the Oyagami (God the Parent) who calls himself "God of Origin, God in Truth."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She volunteered to be his substitute, and this is said to be the moment when she was possessed by and received a revelation from Tenri O no Mikoto, the Oyagami (God the Parent) who calls himself "God of Origin, God in Truth."

sen.j: その神は、みきを「神の社」として貰い受けたいと申し出て、その申し出を受け入れるならば、世の人々を救済するが、拒めば、中山家を滅ぼすと言ったという。
sen.e: It is said that that god requested to have her as "Kami no Yashiro" (Shrine of God) and save humankind but also threatened to destroy the Nakayama family if they refused.
It is said that the god requested to have her as "Kami no Yashiro" (The Shrine of God) to save humankind but also threatened to destroy the Nakayama family if they refused.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the god requested to have her as "Kami no Yashiro" (The Shrine of God) to save humankind but also threatened to destroy the Nakayama family if they refused.

sen.j: 10月26日になって、夫の善兵衛がみきを「神の社」となることを承諾すると、みきの苦痛がおさまったとされる（天理教では、この日を「立教の元一日」としている）。
sen.e: On October 26, her husband, Zenbei, agreed to let Miki become "Kami no Yashiro"(Shrine of God), and then Miki's pain subsided (In Tenrikyo, this is called "the day of origin").
On October 26, when her husband, Zenbei, agreed to allow Miki to become "Kami no Yashiro"(The Shrine of God), Miki's pain subsided (In Tenrikyo, this is called "the day of origin").
sen.cmt: 自然な表現になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: On October 26, when her husband, Zenbei, agreed to allow Miki to become "Kami no Yashiro"(The Shrine of God), Miki's pain subsided (In Tenrikyo, this is called "the day of origin").

sen.j: みきは、天理王命の神命に従い、例えば、近隣の貧民に惜しみなく財を分け与えた。
sen.e: Miki followerd the orders from Tenri O no Mikoto, and gave away her possessions to the poor in her neighborhood, for instance, and she kept on following the divine orders even when she was in utmost poverty.
Miki followed the orders from Tenri O no Mikoto, and gave away her possessions to the poor around her.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Miki followed the orders from Tenri O no Mikoto, and gave away her possessions to the poor around her.

sen.j: 自らの財産をことごとく失うことがあっても、その神命に従う信念は変わらなかった。
sen.e: She continued to follow the divine orders even when she was in utmost poverty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She continued to follow the divine orders even when she was in utmost poverty.

sen.j: 次第にみきの教えにを従う人の数も増え、元治元年（1864年）、専用に勤め場所を建築。
sen.e: The number of her followers gradually increased, and in 1864, she built a place for the service.
The number of her followers gradually increased, and in 1864, she built a place for service.
The number of her followers gradually increased, and in 1864, she built a place for service.

sen.j: このころより各地に出向き布教を行いはじめる。
sen.e: It was about this time that she started visiting many places for propagation, and also persecution intensified and sometimes she was summoned to a jinya (regional government office) and forbidden to worship her god.
Around this time, she began propagating in various places.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処自然な表現になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Around this time, she started to actively involved in missionary work in various places.

sen.j: だが、次第に迫害も増え、時には陣屋に呼び出され、神を祀るのを禁止されることもあった。
sen.e: However, prosecution intensified, and there were times when she was summoned to a jinya (regional government office) and forbidden to worship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, prosecution intensified, and there were times when she was summoned to a regional government office and forbidden to worship.
sen.cmt: jinya はローマ字表記にする必要はないと思いますので、変更しました。

sen.j: 慶応3年1月、『みかぐらうた』の製作に従事、神楽のてぶりや鳴り物の稽古をはじめた。
sen.e: In 1867, she engaged in the composition of "Mikagura Uta" and started practicing Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine) and musical instruments.
In 1867, she engaged in the composition of "Mikagura Uta" and started practicing Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at a shrine) and musical instruments.
In 1867, she engaged in the composition of "Mikagura Uta" and started practicing Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at a shrine) and musical instruments.

sen.j: 慶応3年、京都神祇管領吉田家に願い出て、布教認可を得て、公認となり迫害は収まった。
sen.e: In 1867, she made a plea to the Yoshida family, Jingi Kanrei (person in control of the Shinto worship) in Kyoto, and obtained an officially recognized licence for propagation so that the persecution against them subsided.

In 1867, she made a plea to the Yoshida family, the Jingi Kanrei (person in control of the Shinto worship) in Kyoto, and obtained a license for propagation, so that the persecution against them subsided.
sen.cmt: officially recognized license をlicenseに省略しました。
sen.e: In 1867, she made a plea to the Yoshida family, the Jingi Kanrei (person in control of the Shinto worship) in Kyoto, and obtained a license for missionary in which helped to subside the persecution against them.

sen.j: しかし、明治維新後、吉田家の公認は無効となり、明治政府の弾圧が続く中の、明治20年2月18日没する。
sen.e: However, after Meiji Restoration, the official recognition given by the Yoshida family became invalid, and in the midst of oppression under the Meiji Government, Miki died on Februrary 18, 1887.
However, after the Meiji Restoration, the official recognition given by the Yoshida family became invalid, and in the midst of oppression under the Meiji Government, Miki died on February 18, 1887.
However, after the Meiji Restoration, the official recognition given by the Yoshida family became invalid, and in the midst of oppression under the Meiji Government, Miki died on February 18, 1887.

sen.j: その間、中山みきは、神命に従い、明治初年には、『みかぐらづとめ』を完成。
sen.e: Until her death, Miki NAKAYAMA followed the divine orders and established the foundation of Tenrikyo by completing "Mikagura Zutome" in 1868, starting to write "Ofudesaki" in the New Year's Holidays, 1869, constructing the model for the kanrodai (pillar of heavenly dew), and designating the jiba (the birthplace of mankind) (June 19, 1875).
Until her death, Miki NAKAYAMA followed the divine orders and established the foundation of Tenrikyo by completing "Mikagura Zutome" in 1868.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Until her death, Miki NAKAYAMA followed the divine orders and established the foundation of Tenrikyo by completing "Mikagura Zutome" in 1868.

sen.j: 翌明治2年正月から『おふでさき』書始め、かんろだいの雛形製作、ぢばさだめ（明治8年6月29日）など、天理教の基を築いた。
sen.e: She started to write "Ofudesaki" during the New Year Holiday of 1869, also constructing the model for the kanrodai (pillar of heavenly dew), and designating the jiba (the birthplace of mankind) (June 19, 1875).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She started to write "Ofudesaki" during the New Year Holiday of 1869, also constructing the model for the kanrodai (pillar of heavenly dew), and designating the jiba (the birthplace of mankind) (June 19, 1875).

sen.j: 『みかぐらうた』『おふでさき』『泥海古記』『おさしづ』は、天理教の根本の教義・教典となった。
sen.e: "Mikagura Uta", "Ofudesaki", "Doroumi Koki", and "Osashizu" became fundamental creeds and scriptures of Tenrikyo, and after Miki's death, Izo IBURI, who was the honseki (revelatory leadership position in Tenrikyo), continued to propagate Tenrikyo (Most of "Osashizu" was handed down through Izo Iburi's preaching).
"Mikagura Uta," "Ofudesaki," "Doroumi Koki," and "Osashizu" became fundamental creeds and scriptures of Tenrikyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Mikagura Uta," "Ofudesaki," "Doroumi Koki," and "Osashizu" became fundamental creeds and scriptures of Tenrikyo.

sen.j: 没後も本席・飯降伊蔵のもと、天理教として布教が行われた（『おさしづ』のほとんどは、飯降伊蔵の口を通してのもの）。
sen.e: After Miki's death, Izo IBURI, who was the honseki (revelatory leadership position in Tenrikyo), continued to propagate Tenrikyo (Most of "Osashizu" was handed down through Izo Iburi's preaching).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Miki's death, Izo IBURI, who was the honseki (revelatory leadership position in Tenrikyo), continued to propagate Tenrikyo (Most of "Osashizu" was handed down through Izo Iburi's preaching).

sen.j: 夫善兵衛との間に、一男五女（中山秀司、おまさ、おやす、おはる、おつね、こかん）を授かる（初代真柱中山眞之亮はおはるの三男である）。
sen.e: Miki and her husband, Zenbei, had one son and five daughters (Shuji NAKAYAMA, Omasa, Oyasu, Oharu, Otsune, Kokan) (the first Shinbashira (central pillar), Shinnosuke NAKAYAMA was the third son of Oharu).

Miki and her husband, Zenbei, had one son and five daughters (Shuji NAKAYAMA, Omasa, Oyasu, Oharu, Otsune, Kokan) (the first Shinbashira (central pillar), Shinnosuke NAKAYAMA was the third son of Oharu).

Miki and her husband, Zenbei, had one son and five daughters (Shuji NAKAYAMA, Omasa, Oyasu, Oharu, Otsune, Kokan) (the first Shinbashira (central pillar), Shinnosuke NAKAYAMA was the third son of Oharu).

sen.j: なお、天理教では人が没した場合、人間の発祥の根源「ぢば」へ帰ると解釈するため、「亡くなった」「死去した」とはせずに、「出直し」と表現する。
sen.e: In Tenrikyo, when someone passes away, he or she is considered as going back to the "Jiba", the birthplace of humankind, so they don't use expressions such as "be dead" or "die,"but "denaoshi"(passing away for rebirth).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Tenrikyo, when someone passes away, it is believed that he or she returns to the "Jiba," the birthplace of mankind, so they do not use expressions such as "be dead" or "pass away," but use "denaoshi" (rebirth).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: In Tenrikyo, when someone passes away, it is believed that he or she returns to the "Jiba," the birthplace of mankind, so they do not use expressions such as "be dead" or "pass away," but use "denaoshi" (rebirth).

sen.j: しかし、教祖の中山みきだけは「現身（うつしみ）を隠される」と表現している。
sen.e: However, regarding the death of the founder, Miki NAKAYAMA, they say "she has hidden her figure."

sen.e: However, regarding the death of the founder, Miki NAKAYAMA, they say "she has hidden her figure."
However, regarding the death of the founder, Miki NAKAYAMA, they say "she has hidden her figure."

sen.j: これは、「魂は永久に元の屋敷に留まり、存命のまま一れつ人間の成人を見守り、ご守護してくださっている」（天理教道友社「ようこそおかえり」 1985年刊より）という考えによるものである。
sen.e: This is based on the idea that "her soul stays at the Residence of Origin forever and watches over the growth of the whole humankind and guards us" (from "Yokoso Okaeri": Tenrikyo Doyusha, 1985)
This is based on the idea that "her soul resides at the Residence of Origin forever and watches over the growth of mankind and guards us" (from "Yokoso Okaeri": Tenrikyo Doyusha, 1985).
sen.cmt: staysをresidesにしました。Whole of humankindをmankindに省略しました。
sen.e: This is based on the idea that "her soul resides at the Residence of Origin forever and watches over the growth of mankind and guards us" (from "Yokoso Okaeri": Tenrikyo Doyusha, 1985).

sen.j: 天理教本部では、中山みきは教祖殿で生活しているとされている。
sen.e: At the headquarter of Tenrikyo, Miki NAKAYAMA is considered as living in the residence of the founder, so the believers still attend to her, by serving meals just as when she was alive, for instance.
At the headquarters of Tenrikyo, the followers believe Miki NAKAYAMA is still alive, and resides in the temple of the founder.

sen.j: そのせいか、生前と同じように食事が運ばれるなど、いろいろなお世話がなされている。
sen.e: They prepare meals for her, and attend to her just as when she lived.
